profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Connecticut Library Staff on August 20, 2010

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: Probate record books, None; Probate files, 1834-1973.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Burlington, Hartford County, Town established in May 1806, Parent Town: Bristol

The Burlington Probate District was constituted June 3, 1834, from the Farmington Probate District. The Burlington Probate District merged with the Farmington Probate District on January 5, 2011 to create the Farmington and Burlington Probate District which serves the municipalities of Burlington and Farmington.
Town of Burlington, Probate District chronology:

May 1806 - June 2, 1834, Farmington District
June 3, 1834 - January 4, 2011, Burlington District
January 5, 2011 - Present, Farmington and Burlington District
For Probate Court contact information and hours of operation see, .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Probate record books, None. Contact the probate court to access original record books. See Alternative Form Available note below.
Probate files, 1834-1973. Probate files may consist of estates, conservatorships, guardianships, commitments, and insolvencies. See Alternative Form Available note below.

Inventory control book, 1834-1945 (coverage). Also known as the Godard Digest, it is a list of probate files transferred to the Connecticut State Library. It was compiled at the Connecticut State Library under the direction of State Librarian George S. Godard.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Accessions 1913-003 and T003284 are each arranged alphabetically.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aid
otherfindaid.p: Record Books: Index cards for the record books have been scanned. Ask History and Genealogy staff for assistance. Note: CSL does not hold any original record books. See Alternate Form Available section for volumes available on microfilm.

Probate Files: The Probate Estate Papers Index, located in the index corridor adjacent to the History and Genealogy Reading Room, has two parts, a general index covering most of the state, and a Hartford Probate District index covering Hartford and some surrounding towns, 1820-1920. The index cards are arranged alphabetically by individual's last name and first names. The cards have the individual's name, town of residence, probate district, and list of items contained in the estate packet. To request retrieval of an estate packet, copy at least the estate name, file date, and probate district name from the index card. The probate files in Accession 1913-003 are represented in this index.
Probate Files: The History and Genealogy reference staff has access to an index for the probate files in accession 2012-013.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Researchers should first consult use copies when available. See Alternate Form Available Section below.

Probate files from 1921-1973 are RESTRICTED as they may contain confidential documents. Tax returns (succession, transfer and estate tax returns and all attachments) from January 1, 1921 and later are confidential per Connecticut General Statutes §12-15.

altformavail.head: Alternative Form Available
altformavail.p: Record books, volumes 1-4, 7, 1835-1927; probate files, 1834-1945; and inventory control book (Godard Digest) were microfilmed by the Genealogical Society of Utah and are available for use in the History and Genealogy reading room or through the .

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The probate files in accession 1913-003 were transferred to the Connecticut State Library on the following dates (with date span of files): November 26, 1913 (1834-1885); March 13, 1931 (1847-1926); August 16, 1948 (1916-1945). They were interfiled into one alphabetic sequence.
The probate files in accession 2012-013 were transferred to the Connecticut State Library on January 18, 2012.
It is not known when the probate files in accession T003284 were transferred to the Connecticut State Library.

note.p: Index of the four accessions of probate files now merged into accession 1913-003
Also known as the Godard Digest
There is no index for this accession

did.unittitle: Turrill - Zima; and Minor Guardianships, A - Z
